title: Exploring Feelings in 'The Pout-Pout Fish'
description: In this lesson, students will learn about the feelings and motivations of the characters in 'The Pout-Pout Fish', explore important events in the story, and make predictions about what might happen next.

prompts.input: Why do you think the Pout-Pout Fish feels sad at the beginning of the story? What clues in the text help you understand his feelings?
hints: Look for words that describe how he feels.
Think about what happens around him that might make him feel this way.

prompts.input: How do the other sea creatures react to the Pout-Pout Fish's feelings? What do you think this shows about their characters?
hints: Consider how they talk to him or act around him.
Think about how their reactions might change the Pout-Pout Fish's feelings.

prompts.input: What do you think will happen next after the Pout-Pout Fish learns to change his feelings? Why do you think that?
hints: Think about how his change might affect his friendships.
Consider what lessons he might have learned that could help him in the future.
